text: Dr. Kristine Karlson (born November 16, 1963) is an American rower. She competed in the women's quadruple sculls event at the 1992 Summer Olympics. After graduating from the University of Connecticut School of Medicine, Karlson earned her doctorate. Although her medical studies had caused her to miss national races, she still competed in the 1989 World Rowing Championships and won gold. As a sports and family physician, she has worked at Dartmouth College, FISA events, and the USA national team. ==References== Category:1963 births Category:Living people Category:American female rowers Category:Olympic rowers of the United States Category:Rowers at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:University of Connecticut alumni Category:Sportspeople from Detroit
title: Kristine Karlson
